message_1: A substitution cipher replaces each letter in a message with a different letter of the alphabet. A particular substitution cipher replaces each letter with the letter that is three positions to the right in the alphabet. What would the ciphertext for the plaintext "EXAMPLE MESSAGE" be using this substitution cipher?
message_2:
To encode the plaintext "EXAMPLE MESSAGE" using this substitution cipher, we will replace each letter with the letter that is three positions to the right in the alphabet. We will keep the spaces as they are.

E -> H
X -> A
A -> D
M -> P
P -> S
L -> O
E -> H
(space)
M -> P
E -> H
S -> V
S -> V
A -> D
G -> J
E -> H

So, the ciphertext for the plaintext "EXAMPLE MESSAGE" would be "HADPSOH PHVVHJH".
